page.title: 10Finding Work
page.content: Of the two hundred and eighteen pupils who left Tadcaster Grammar School in 1984, two hundred and sixteen successfully found{employment.}Most of them are on a{Youth Training Scheme.} Most of the people in Tadcaster work at the breweries of which there are three, Sam Smith's, John Smith's and Bass Charrington. Quite a number also find work in the shops and in the pubs, of which there are thirteen. The {unemployment}rate in Tadcaster is very low. There are only about one hundred people unemployed. However, there is much{community work}to be done and a large number of elderly people needing care and attention. Much more could be done to create jobs like this.
